page.title: 02PRINCIPAL FEATURES - TWO
page.content: This area of{Middle Rasen}has, disecting it into two halves, the{A46 (Grimsby to Lincoln) road running in a north-south direction. The road follows the western edge of the Lincolnshire Wolds. Off the A46, going westwards, is the{A1103,}the main road to Gainsborough. A few{minor roads connect these main roads with farms and the communities of Middle Rasen, Osgodby and Walesby. Just under one kilometre from the A46 and running parallel to it is the single track{railway}line from Lincoln to the Humber Bank towns of Grimsby, Cleethorpes, Scunthorpe and Immingham. A 125 High Speed service to London uses this route daily and other {passenger}services connect with all parts of the country.{Frieght}trains to and from the Humber Industries use the line regularly.
